what: Compile, Format, and Visualize Sensor String Data
title: Compile, Format, and Visualize Sensor String Data
text: package replaces strings package. New features: Cleaner code don’t need export intermediate “raw” “trim” files arguments specify templates Additional functions (e.g., ss_download_data()) Variable names consistent Climate Forecast conventions Formal tests helpful Error Warning messages Compile, format, visualize Water Quality (temperature, dissolved oxygen, salinity) data measured different sensors.

title: Compile, Format, and Visualize Sensor String Data
text: can install development version sensorstrings GitHub :

title: Compile, Format, and Visualize Sensor String Data
text: Centre Marine Applied Research (CMAR) coordinates extensive Coastal Monitoring Program measure Essential Ocean Variables around coast Nova Scotia, Canada. three main branches program: Water Quality, Currents, Waves. Processed data branch can viewed downloaded several sources, outlined CMAR Report & Data Access Cheat Sheet (download clickable links). sensorstrings package backbone data pipeline Water Quality branch Coastal Monitoring Program. used organize, compile, format, visualize data Water Quality data. Water Quality data (temperature, dissolved oxygen, salinity) collected using “sensor strings”. sensor string attached seafloor anchor suspended sub-surface buoy, autonomous sensors attached various depths (Figure 1). string typically includes three sensor models: Hobo, aquaMeasure, VR2AR (Table 1). Strings deployed station several months data measured every 1 minute 1 hour, depending sensor. Figure 1: Typical sensor string configuration (scale).  retrieval, data sensor exported separate csv file using manufacturer-specific software. type sensor generates data file unique columns header fields, poses significant challenge compiling data deployment single format analysis. sensorstrings package offers functions compile, format, convert units, visualize sensor string data. sensorstrings developed specifically streamline CMAR’s workflow, flexible enough users can apply process data accepted sensors (Table 1). Vignettes come information Water Quality data collection processing, visit CMAR Water Quality Data Collection & Processing Cheat Sheet (download clickable links).

title: Compile, Format, and Visualize Sensor String Data
text: Consider string deployed May 31, 2019 October 19, 2019 three sensors:

title: Compile, Format, and Visualize Sensor String Data
text: data sensor saved separate csv file, manufacturer-specific columns. Import raw data files: Examine first rows raw data file:
code: path <- system.file("extdata", package = "sensorstrings")  aquameasure_raw <- ss_read_aquameasure_data(   path = paste0(path, "/aquameasure"),    file_name = "aquameasure-670364.csv" )  hobo_raw <- ss_read_hobo_data(   path = paste0(path, "/hobo"),    file_name = "10755220.csv" )  vemco_raw <- ss_read_vemco_data(   path = paste0(path, "/vemco"),    file_name = "vemco-547109.csv" )

title: Compile, Format, and Visualize Sensor String Data
code: head(aquameasure_raw) #>                       Timestamp(UTC) Time Corrected(seconds)             Sensor #> 1  209s after startup (time not set)                      NA aquaMeasure-670364 #> 2  353s after startup (time not set)                      NA aquaMeasure-670364 #> 3 1226s after startup (time not set)                      NA aquaMeasure-670364 #> 4 2143s after startup (time not set)                      NA aquaMeasure-670364 #> 5 3006s after startup (time not set)                      NA aquaMeasure-670364 #> 6 3875s after startup (time not set)                      NA aquaMeasure-670364 #>        Record Type Dissolved Oxygen Temperature Device Tilt Battery Voltage #> 1      Device Tilt               NA          NA        90.4              NA #> 2      Temperature               NA       22.68          NA              NA #> 3 Dissolved Oxygen            100.5          NA          NA              NA #> 4      Device Tilt               NA          NA        91.0              NA #> 5      Device Tilt               NA          NA        91.1              NA #> 6 Dissolved Oxygen            100.5          NA          NA              NA #>   TimeSet Time Text #> 1      NA   NA   NA #> 2      NA   NA   NA #> 3      NA   NA   NA #> 4      NA   NA   NA #> 5      NA   NA   NA #> 6      NA   NA   NA

title: Compile, Format, and Visualize Sensor String Data

Set up parameters, Errors, and Warnings for the compile_** functions — set_up_compile
text: path File path folder aquameasure, hobo, vemco folder. sn_table data frame three columns: sensor, codeserial, depth, returned ss_read_log(). deployment_dates dataframe two columns. first column holds deployment date (Date object, POSIXct object, character string order year, month, day), second column holds retrieval date (Date object, POSIXct object, character string order year, month, day). sensor_make Make sensor compiled. match name folder raw data files saved found sensor column sn_table. common entries "aquameasure", "hobo", "vemco".

title: Set up parameters, Errors, and Warnings for the compile_** functions — set_up_compile
text: Returns list parameters used compile_** functions.   Returns Errors Warnings expected files found  folder.

what: Compiles data from aquaMeasure sensors — ss_compile_aquameasure_data
title: Compiles data from aquaMeasure sensors — ss_compile_aquameasure_data
text: Compiles formats temperature, dissolved oxygen, salinity,   andn/device depth data aquaMeasure sensors.

title: Compiles data from aquaMeasure sensors — ss_compile_aquameasure_data
Compiles data from aquaMeasure sensors — ss_compile_aquameasure_data
text: path File path Hobo folder. sn_table data frame three columns: sensor, codeserial, depth, returned ss_read_log(). deployment_dates dataframe two columns. first column holds deployment date (Date object, POSIXct object, character string order year, month, day), second column holds retrieval date (Date object, POSIXct object, character string order year, month, day). trim Logical value indicating whether trim data dates specified deployment_dates. (Note: four hours added retrieval date account AST, e.g., case sensor retrieved 20:00 AST, 00:00 UTC next day.) Default trim = TRUE.

title: Compiles data from aquaMeasure sensors — ss_compile_aquameasure_data
text: Returns tibble data compiled aquaMeasure   files path/aquameasure.

title: Compiles data from aquaMeasure sensors — ss_compile_aquameasure_data
text: raw aquaMeasure data must saved folder named aquaMeasure   csv format. Folder name case-sensitive. Rows undefined ... (time set) values   Timestamp(UTC) column filtered . timestamp columns must order "ymd IMS p", "Ymd IMS p", "Ymd   HM", "Ymd HMS", "dmY HM", "dmY HMS". MOVE QAQCMAR??? Negative Dissolved Oxygen values converted NA. "ERR" values converted NA.

title: Compiles data from aquaMeasure sensors — ss_compile_aquameasure_data
text: Danielle Dempsey

what: Format temperature data from Vemco deployment — ss_compile_vemco_data

title: Format temperature data from Vemco deployment — ss_compile_vemco_data
Format temperature data from Vemco deployment — ss_compile_vemco_data
text: path File path Vemco folder. folder one csv file extracted using Vue software. file types folder ignored. sn_table data frame three columns: sensor, codeserial, depth, returned ss_read_log(). deployment_dates dataframe two columns. first column holds deployment date (Date object, POSIXct object, character string order year, month, day), second column holds retrieval date (Date object, POSIXct object, character string order year, month, day). trim Logical value indicating whether trim data dates specified deployment_dates. (Note: four hours added retrieval date account AST, e.g., case sensor retrieved 20:00 AST, 00:00 UTC next day.) Default trim = TRUE.

title: Format temperature data from Vemco deployment — ss_compile_vemco_data
text: Returns tibble data compiled file path/vemco.

title: Format temperature data from Vemco deployment — ss_compile_vemco_data
text: raw Vemco data must saved folder named Vemco csv   format. Folder name case-sensitive. "Temperature" entries Description column,   extracted compiled. "Temperature" entries,   "Average temperature" entries, extracted compiled.   Otherwise, function stop error message.

title: Format temperature data from Vemco deployment — ss_compile_vemco_data
text: Danielle Dempsey

what: Converts values in the DEPTH column to an ordered factor — ss_convert_depth_to_ordered_factor
title: Converts values in the DEPTH column to an ordered factor — ss_convert_depth_to_ordered_factor
text: function simplifies converting DEPTH column class   numeric, factor, character ordered factor,   preferred using function plot_variables_at_depth().

title: Converts values in the DEPTH column to an ordered factor — ss_convert_depth_to_ordered_factor
Converts values in the DEPTH column to an ordered factor — ss_convert_depth_to_ordered_factor
text: dat Data tidy format, returned function convert_to_tidydata(). Must include least one column: DEPTH (factor, character, numeric).

title: Converts values in the DEPTH column to an ordered factor — ss_convert_depth_to_ordered_factor
text: Returns dat.tidy, DEPTH column converted   ordered factor.

title: Converts values in the DEPTH column to an ordered factor — ss_convert_depth_to_ordered_factor
text: use function plot_variables_at_depth(), DEPTH   must factor DEPTH mapped discrete color scale.   legend display correctly (e.g. depths arranged shallow   deep), DEPTH must ordered factor. DEPTH column may values can coerced class   numeric, qualitative descriptors, combination .   different level assigned unique values   DEPTH. cause confusion DEPTH includes   numeric qualitative values, example level (colour)   "Surface" level "2 m"). Qualitative DEPTH values standardized "Surface",   "Sub-surface", "Middle", "Bottom". Accepted qualitative DEPTH   values "Bottom", "bottom", "Middle", "middle", "Sub surface",   "Sub-Surface", Sub-surface", "sub surface", "sub-surface", "Sub", "sub",   "Surface", "surface". values cause function stop   error message. numeric depths: smallest value assigned first level,   second smallest value assigned second level, . qualitative depths: assigned order "Surface" < "Sub-surface" <   "Middle" < "Bottom".

title: Converts values in the DEPTH column to an ordered factor — ss_convert_depth_to_ordered_factor
text: Danielle Dempsey

text: Extract information deployment log

title: Extract information from deployment log — ss_read_log
Extract information from deployment log — ss_read_log
text: path File path Log folder.

title: Extract information from deployment log — ss_read_log
text: Returns list 5 elements. deployment.dates   dataframe two columns: start.date (date deployment)  end.date (date retrieval). area.info dataframe   five columns: waterbody, latitude, longitude,  station, lease. HOBO, , vemco dataframe two columns: SENSOR (serial number)   corresponding DEPTH (depth deployment m).

title: Extract information from deployment log — ss_read_log
text: log must saved folder called Log .csv, .xlsx .xls   format, must include following columns: Deployment_Waterbody: waterbody string deployed Location_Description: station name Lease#: located aquaculture site, lease number (NA   otherwise) Deployment: deployment date, order "Ymd" Retrieval: retrieval date, order "Ymd" Logger_Latitude: latitude string deployed Logger_Longitude longitude string deployed Logger_Model type sensor; see options Serial# sensor serial number Sensor_Depth: Depth sensor deployed columns ignored. Entries Logger_Model column can "HOBO Pro V2", "HOBO ",   "TidbiT MX2303", "TidbiT MX2203"  "aquaMeasure DOT", "aquaMeasure SAL",   "aquaMeasure SST", "VR2AR". (mis-spellings accepted: "HOBO pro   V2", "HOBO_Pro_V2", "aquameasure DOT", "aquameasure SAL", "aquameasure   SST") Warning message printed console function   recognize sensor log. message printed console Hobo, aquaMeasure, Vemco   sensors found log. message printed console one unique   entry Deployment_Waterbody, Location_Description,   Deployment, Retrieval, Logger_Latitude,   Logger_Longitude. one eligible file (csv, .xlsx .xls) Log   folder, function stop error.

title: Extract information from deployment log — ss_read_log
text: Danielle Dempsey
